title: 2021 Porsche 718 Cayman GT4
description: This 2021 Porsche 718 Cayman GT4 is finished in GT Silver Metallic over Black leather and Race-Tex and is powered by a 4.0-liter flat-six linked with a seven-speed PDK transaxle and a limited-slip differential with PTV. Features include the Sport Chrono Package, aftermarket carbon-fiber exterior accents, 20" 718 Spyder wheels, carbon-fiber full bucket seats, carbon-fiber interior trim, and xenon headlights with PDLS. The seller purchased the car in 2024 and has since added approximately 1k of the 13k indicated miles. This 718 Cayman GT4 is now offered in Massachusetts with a clean New York title in the seller's name.
author: bringatrailer
excerpt: Bid for the chance to own a 2021 Porsche 718 Cayman GT4 at auction with Bring a Trailer, the home of the best vintage and classic cars online. Lot #199,683.
text: This 2021 Porsche 718 Cayman GT4 is finished in GT Silver Metallic over Black leather and Race-Tex and is powered by a 4.0-liter flat-six linked with a seven-speed PDK transaxle and a limited-slip differential with PTV. Features include the Sport Chrono Package, aftermarket carbon-fiber exterior accents, 20″ 718 Spyder wheels, carbon-fiber full bucket seats, carbon-fiber interior trim, and xenon headlights with PDLS. The seller purchased the car in 2024 and has since added approximately 1k of the 13k indicated miles. This 718 Cayman GT4 is now offered in Massachusetts with a clean New York title in the seller’s name. The car is finished in GT Silver Metallic (M7Z) and is modified with a carbon-fiber front spoiler, mirror caps, intake scoops, side skirts, rear diffuser, and front trunk lid with Naca ducts. Retained factory equipment includes a rear wing, rear ParkAssist, auto-dimming mirrors, and bi-xenon headlights in Black with the Porsche Dynamic Light System (PDLS). The Carfax report notes that an undisclosed area of the car sustained “minor damage” in November 2022 with no additional information provided. The removed factory exterior components are included in the sale. Satin silver powder-coated 20″ 718 Spyder alloy wheels are mounted with 245/35 front and 295/30 rear Continental ExtremeContact DWS06 Plus tires. The car is equipped with Porsche Active Suspension Management (PASM), and stopping power is provided by ventilated and cross-drilled rotors with red-finished calipers at each corner. The front and rear brake pads were replaced in the fall of 2023, and the seller tells us that the previous owner installed aftermarket suspension components that have since been removed. The carbon-fiber full bucket seats are trimmed in Black leather and Race-Tex with Silver stitching and headrest embroidery. Matching upholstery and thread extend to the dashboard, center console, and door panels. Interior options consist of the Sport Chrono Package, Silver Grey seatbelts, carbon-fiber trim, Apple CarPlay connectivity, and dual-zone automatic climate control. The leather-wrapped steering wheel is equipped with shift paddles and frames a 200-mph speedometer, a tachometer with an 8k-rpm redline, and a TFT LCD screen. The digital odometer indicates 13k miles, approximately 1k of which were added under current ownership. Located in a sealed compartment forward of the rear trunk, the 4.0-liter flat-six was factory rated at 414 horsepower and 317 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a seven-speed PDK dual-clutch automatic transaxle and a limited-slip differential with Porsche Torque Vectoring (PTV). html:
This 2021 Porsche 718 Cayman GT4 is finished in GT Silver Metallic over Black leather and Race-Tex and is powered by a 4.0-liter flat-six linked with a seven-speed PDK transaxle and a limited-slip differential with PTV. Features include the Sport Chrono Package, aftermarket carbon-fiber exterior accents, 20″ 718 Spyder wheels, carbon-fiber full bucket seats, carbon-fiber interior trim, and xenon headlights with PDLS. The seller purchased the car in 2024 and has since added approximately 1k of the 13k indicated miles. This 718 Cayman GT4 is now offered in Massachusetts with a clean New York title in the seller’s name.

The car is finished in GT Silver Metallic (M7Z) and is modified with a carbon-fiber front spoiler, mirror caps, intake scoops, side skirts, rear diffuser, and front trunk lid with Naca ducts. Retained factory equipment includes a rear wing, rear ParkAssist, auto-dimming mirrors, and bi-xenon headlights in Black with the Porsche Dynamic Light System (PDLS). The Carfax report notes that an undisclosed area of the car sustained “minor damage” in November 2022 with no additional information provided. The removed factory exterior components are included in the sale.

Satin silver powder-coated 20″ 718 Spyder alloy wheels are mounted with 245/35 front and 295/30 rear Continental ExtremeContact DWS06 Plus tires. The car is equipped with Porsche Active Suspension Management (PASM), and stopping power is provided by ventilated and cross-drilled rotors with red-finished calipers at each corner. The front and rear brake pads were replaced in the fall of 2023, and the seller tells us that the previous owner installed aftermarket suspension components that have since been removed.

The carbon-fiber full bucket seats are trimmed in Black leather and Race-Tex with Silver stitching and headrest embroidery. Matching upholstery and thread extend to the dashboard, center console, and door panels. Interior options consist of the Sport Chrono Package, Silver Grey seatbelts, carbon-fiber trim, Apple CarPlay connectivity, and dual-zone automatic climate control.

The leather-wrapped steering wheel is equipped with shift paddles and frames a 200-mph speedometer, a tachometer with an 8k-rpm redline, and a TFT LCD screen. The digital odometer indicates 13k miles, approximately 1k of which were added under current ownership.

Located in a sealed compartment forward of the rear trunk, the 4.0-liter flat-six was factory rated at 414 horsepower and 317 lb-ft of torque. Power is sent to the rear wheels through a seven-speed PDK dual-clutch automatic transaxle and a limited-slip differential with Porsche Torque Vectoring (PTV).

The Carfax report notes the aforementioned damage entry.
